section: This JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") made and entered into this 20th day of Friday, March 2020 (the "Execution Date")
explanation: The inclusion of "Friday" in the date is unusual and potentially problematic. While not strictly a contradiction, it introduces unnecessary ambiguity. Legal documents typically specify the date numerically (day, month, year) to avoid any confusion. Including the day of the week is superfluous and could lead to disputes if the stated day of the week doesn't align with the numerical date. Additionally, the phrase "made and entered into" is redundant; either "made" or "entered into" would suffice.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: This section outlines the payment terms for JVLS, LLC. It states they will pay $60,000 within 90 days of signing the agreement, plus 10% of any generated gross revenue from awarded contracts, in addition to the total contributions.  The phrase "in addition to the total contributions" is ambiguous. It's unclear whether the 10% of gross revenue is also part of the 'Capital Contribution' or separate. This could lead to disagreement on whether this 10% is considered part of their initial agreed-upon capital contribution.

section: BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section describes BorrowMoney.com, Inc.'s capital contribution. It states they are contributing 1,500 square feet of leased/rented office space and includes 'specified description of duty'. The value is listed as $3,500,000.00 USD. There are a few issues: 1) The phrase 'including specified description of duty' is vague and unclear. It's unclear what that 'specified description of duty' is, and why it is included in this line. 2) Office space is rarely considered a capital contribution to a company unless the company actually purchases the office space in its name. Even then, it would need to show proof of purchase with the name of the company on it. Here, it is mentioned that the office space is Leased/rent which indicates that BorrowMoney.com does not actually own the space and it is essentially just a place to work. 3) If BorrowMoney.com does not own the space, then assigning a value of $3,500,000.00 to that space is misleading and does not make much sense.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This entry for JVLS, LLC has several issues. First, it repeats the confusing language about "Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Addition to The Total Contributions." as described in the explanation on page 3. Second, it assigns a value of $3,500,000.00 USD to their contribution, despite them contributing only $60,000 in cash. This creates a significant inconsistency.  It implies that the 10% of gross revenue somehow accounts for the remaining $3,440,000, which is highly improbable and not clearly stated. The statement "in addition to the total contributions" when the contribution is only the initial cash payment is confusing.

section: The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture.
explanation: This section is contradictory. It states that a withdrawing member's interest is based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities, however, the method to calculate what the value is, is based on revenue generated over the last 3 months. Those two statements do not align with each other, as value from generated revenue and capital account are two different ways to calculate value.

section: Members will provide services to one another on an arms' length basis while remaining independent business entities. There will be no pooling of profits and losses. Each Member is responsible only for its own actions and no Member is an agent for any other Member. Members will not be jointly or severally liable for the actions of the other Members.
explanation: This section attempts to define the nature of the joint venture. However, it states there will be no pooling of profits and losses, which goes against the conventional understanding of a joint venture where profits and losses are typically shared. This contradicts the fundamental purpose of a joint venture, which is to collaborate and share the financial outcomes of a common enterprise.
